org.contentmine.image.pixel

Class PixelNucleusFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.contentmine.image.pixel.PixelNucleusFactory

  • public class PixelNucleusFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    an intermediate object which identifies and manages PixelNucleus and PixelNode objects. PixelNode objects can exist independently of a PixelGraph (though normally they are then used to create a graph). The node can be either:
    • Dot (a single isolated pixel)
    • terminal (a pixel with only one neighbour)
    • nucleus (a pixel with 3 or more connections)
    Because the details of the nucleus matter, the node is described by a PixelNucleus and a centre Pixel. The precise details of PixelNucleus depend on what thinning algorithm has been applied. PixelNucleusCollection is used to search thinned islands for possible nodes, and their nuclei. In some uses, the nucleus is the primary object, in others the node, so maps between the two are given. A nucleus can only hold one node; normally this is the "central" node; in rare cases there may be no centre and a convention is used.
    Author:
    pm286
